head.supplied: Public Works Office ¶ Melbourne, 14th January 1858 ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ It having been arranged that the provision for the Service of the Botanic Gardens, Melbourne although appearing on the Estimates as under...

div.p: E58/535, unit 715, VPRS 1189 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 27.2.91. Corrected 10.5.93, 31.5.93. To proof.
Who in Public Works is this letter from?
MS file annotations:
[...]: 'This is approved it is respectfully suggested that the Com of P. Works should obtain quarterly authorities as the regulations require. To issue an authority at once for the year is not in accordance with the Regulations & might lead to objections from the Aud. Office.'
J. Moore: 'Mr Haines does not approve of this Vote being transferred to the President of the Board of Lands & Works and directs that it shall be dealt with as the other Votes under the Control of the Chief Secretary. | JM | 5/2/58'.
[...]: '805 | P.W.O. [Public Works Office] | 15/2/58 | [...]'.
[...]: 'P.Works | 15/2/58'.
T. C. Balmain: 'Noted & returned [...] [...] | Thos [...] Balmain | 23/2/58'.
[...]: ''58/68 " 27/2 | [...]'.
[...]: 'retd 1.3'. Public Works Office

It having been arranged that the provision for the Service of the Botanic Gardens, Melbourne although appearing on the Estimates as under your Departments shall be dealt with as heretofore by the President of the Board of Land and Works, I have the honor to request you will be good enough to obtain the authority of his Excellency the Governor in Council for the expenditure of the sums mentioned in the accompanying list by this Department.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honor to be
